title: KDP Keyword Research - How to Choose an SEO-Optimized Title for Your Book

tactics.name: keyword optimization
tactics.description: Focus on long-tail keywords with lower competition and higher conversion potential
source_quotes: if your book sells well chances are that Amazon is going to increase the rank of your book even for the main keywords

tactics.name: long_tail_keywords
tactics.description: Using long-tail keywords in book titles to target specific audiences and improve search visibility
steps: Integrate keywords into title for relevance
Align title with target audience interests
caveats: May fail if keyword is overly competitive or irrelevant
source_quotes: only a very small percentage of all searches comes from short tail keywords... roughly 70 percent come from long tail keywords

heuristics.name: competition avoidance
heuristics.condition: If short-tail keywords have high competition, prioritize long-tail variations
source_quotes: there is way less competition and we actually have chances to rank higher

heuristics.name: low_review_threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting title optimization
source_quotes: only a very small percentage of all searches comes from short tail keywords

claims.statement: Amazon ranks products based on metadata relevance including title, subtitle, and keywords
source_quotes: Amazon makes a ranking based on many data of course sales... considering the metadata of each product

claims.statement: 70% of searches on KDP come from long-tail keywords
source_quotes: roughly 70 percent come from long tail keywords

niche_patterns.description: Combines target audience identity with specific problem and unique constraint for niche targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates highly specific long-tail keywords with lower competition
source_quotes: the problem of doing a good keyword research on KDP is basically just the problem of finding a good title
